facts.1: Europe Day is celebrated on May 9th to mark the anniversary of the Schuman Declaration.
facts.2: The Schuman Declaration in 1950 proposed the creation of a European Coal and Steel Community, which is considered the beginning of the European Union.
facts.3: Europe Day is a public holiday for the institutions of the European Union.

facts.1: Victory Day is celebrated on May 9th to commemorate the surrender of Nazi Germany in 1945.
facts.2: It is a major public holiday in Russia and many former Soviet republics.
facts.3: Victory Day is marked by military parades, fireworks, and ceremonies honoring veterans.

facts.1: National Lost Sock Memorial Day is observed on May 9th to honor all the socks that have gone missing.
facts.2: It is a whimsical holiday that encourages people to let go of the frustration of lost socks.
facts.3: Some people use this day to repurpose single socks into crafts or cleaning rags.
